properties.name: folderId
properties.label: Folder Id
properties.description: If set, this field contains the folder that this configuration belongs to.

properties.name: title
properties.label: Title
properties.description: Symbolic name for the configuration

properties.name: temporaryDirectoryPath
properties.label: Temporary Directory Path
properties.description: Directory in which temporary files are stored. This directory will be cleaned up when the connection is closed.

properties.name: jumpstation
properties.label: Jumpstation
properties.description: Jumpstation that should be used to reach this host.

properties.name: tmpDeleteOnDisconnect
properties.label: Tmp Delete On Disconnect
properties.description: If true, delete the temporary connection directory when the connection is closed

properties.name: tmpFileCreationRetries
properties.label: Tmp File Creation Retries
properties.description: Number of times Overthere attempts to create a temporary file with a unique name

properties.name: connectionTimeoutMillis
properties.label: Connection Timeout Millis
properties.description: Number of milliseconds Overthere waits for a connection to a remote host to be established

properties.name: protocol
properties.label: Protocol
properties.description: Protocol

properties.name: address
properties.label: Address
properties.description: Address of the host

properties.name: port
properties.label: Port
properties.description: Port on which the Telnet or WinRM server runs

properties.name: username
properties.label: Username
properties.description: Username to connect with

properties.name: password
properties.label: Password
properties.description: Password to use for authentication

properties.name: cifsPort
properties.label: CIFS Port
properties.description: Port on which the CIFS server runs

properties.name: pathShareMappings
properties.label: Windows path to Windows share mappings
properties.description: Mapping from Windows paths to Windows share names, e.g. C:\IBM\WebSphere -> WebSphereShare

properties.name: winrmEnableHttps
properties.label: Enable HTTPS for WinRM
properties.description: Enable SSL communication to the WinRM server

properties.name: timeout
properties.label: Timeout
properties.description: Timeout to use for WinRM messages in XML schema duration format

properties.name: winrsAllowDelegate
properties.label: Allow credential delegation
properties.description: Specifies that the user's credentials can be used to access a remote share, for example, found on a different machine than the target endpoint (WINRM_NATIVE only)

properties.name: winrmContext
properties.label: Winrm Context
properties.description: Context used by the WinRM server (WINRM only)

properties.name: winrmEnvelopSize
properties.label: Winrm Envelop Size
properties.description: Envelop size for WinRM messages (WINRM only)

properties.name: winrmLocale
properties.label: Winrm Locale
properties.description: Locale to use for WinRM messages (WINRM only)

properties.name: winrmHttpsCertificateTrustStrategy
properties.label: Winrm Https Certificate Trust Strategy
properties.description: HTTPS certifiacte trust strategy for WinRM over HTTPS (WINRM_INTERNAL only)

properties.name: winrmHttpsHostnameVerificationStrategy
properties.label: Winrm Https Hostname Verification Strategy
properties.description: HTTPS host name verification strategy for WinRM over HTTPS (WINRM_INTERNAL only)

properties.name: winrmKerberosDebug
properties.label: Winrm Kerberos Debug
properties.description: Enable Kerberos debug messages (WINRM only)

properties.name: winrmKerberosAddPortToSpn
properties.label: Winrm Kerberos Add Port To Spn
properties.description: Add the port number (e.g. 5985) to the service principal name (SPN) for which a Kerberos ticket is requested (WINRM_INTERNAL only)

properties.name: winrmKerberosUseHttpSpn
properties.label: Winrm Kerberos Use Http Spn
properties.description: Use the HTTP protocol in the service principal name (SPN) for which a Kerberos ticket is requested, instead of the default WSMAN protocol (WINRM_INTERNAL only)

properties.name: winrsCompression
properties.label: Winrs Compression
properties.description: Turn on compression. Older installations on remote machines may not support compression so it is off by default (WINRM_NATIVE only)

properties.name: winrsNoecho
properties.label: Winrs Noecho
properties.description: Specifies that echo should be disabled. This may be necessary to ensure that user's answers to remote prompts are not displayed locally (WINRM_NATIVE only)

properties.name: winrsNoprofile
properties.label: Winrs Noprofile
properties.description: Specifies that the user's profile should not be loaded. By default the server will attempt to load the user profile. If the remote user is not a local administrator on the target system then this option will be required (the default willresult in error) (WINRM_NATIVE only)

properties.name: winrsUnencrypted
properties.label: Winrs Unencrypted
properties.description: Disable encryption. Requires the remote host to have been configured to allow that (WINRM_NATIVE only)

properties.name: os
properties.label: Os
properties.description: Os

properties.name: connectionType
properties.label: Connection type
properties.description: Type of CIFS/Telnet/WinRM connection to create (TELNET, WINRM_INTERNAL, WINRM_NATIVE)
